title: Brooklinen Black Friday Sale 2024: It’s Here and Serving Good Sleep
description: See all the early deals we’ve added to our carts during this bedding blowout
author: Blake Bakkila
excerpt: See all the early Black Friday deals we’ve added to our carts during this bedding blowout from sheets and towels to loungewear and duvets.
text: See all the early deals we’ve added to our carts during this bedding blowoutProducts courtesy of Brooklinen; Illustration: Lauren Arzbaecher All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Even though Black Friday doesn’t officially kick off until next week, there’s plenty to shop right now. Year after year, the top-notch Brooklinen Black Friday sale delivers—and 2024’s markdowns are well worth the hype. Now until December 1, you can save 25% off sitewide when you apply the code “BLACKFRIDAY25” at checkout. We’re talking markdowns everything you know you love (or want to try) from Brooklinen, like crisp percale-cotton sheet sets, breathable linen duvet covers, and super-plush bath towels and robes (all of which make cozy, excellent holiday gifts).Beyond the sitewide sale, bundles are also 50% off, allowing you to save on additional home goods like towels, comforters, pillows, and more. For a full scope of the sale, we’ve curated the deals we’re most excited about—including some we’ve already added to our virtual shopping carts.1/6Brooklinen Washed Linen Core Sheet SetLet’s start with Brooklinen’s bread and butter, their original offering: the linen sheets. Contributor Madeleine Luckel was wooed by the body-heat-regulating claims of the natural fiber: “When I got these, I thought white linen sheets year-round might be a slightly bold move, since I don’t live my life on a Greek island, but the nature of the fiber is versatile and temperature-regulating.”And don’t just take our word for it. The best-selling sheets also received a Cleverest Award back in 2021 when illustrator Jordan Sondler said this set “suits the beach-town homemaker I aspire to be and maybe always have been.” Whether you just need a simple fitted sheet or a full set with a duvet cover and pillowcase, Brooklinen has the functionality to customize your order to your liking.2/6Brooklinen Luxe Sateen Core Sheet SetIf linen doesn’t speak to you, Brooklinen’s all-season Luxe Core Sheet Set is a more classic style that’s cool to the touch. It’s a favorite of commerce director Rachel Fletcher, who says she can “definitely feel the difference in quality and the benefits of a higher thread count.” Overall, it’s ideal for sweaty sleepers who prefer something crisper and more substantial than the linen above. Plus, it comes in shades like your standard white or cream, along with limited-edition options like dusky blue and warm toffee.3/6Brooklinen Luxe Sateen Hardcore Sheet BundleThough sateen may initially conjure up visions of ‘80s decadence, these sheets from Brooklinen are as luxurious as they are modern and subtle. With a 480-thread count, they’re a great year-round option.4/6Brooklinen Down Alternative ComforterHailed as the best organic comforter by our editors, Brooklinen’s down alternative comforter is backed by hundreds of five-star reviews. This standout pick is loaded up with eco-friendly and hypoallergenic PET fibers, and it’s available in three different weights—lightweight for the warmer months or hot sleepers, ultra-warm to combat the cold, or all-season for year-round use.5/6Brooklinen Super-Plush Bath TowelsAnother do-not-miss from the Brooklinen sale: The luxe Turkish-cotton Super Plush Bath Towels. They’re the “densest towels on the market,” according to the brand, and are crafted with a special “Z-twist” terrycloth weave that retains plushness even after dozens of washes. (“This is not a towel that has to be washed 100 times before you want to cuddle up in it,” assures contributor Amanda Sims.)6/6Brooklinen Super Plush RobeInspired by the brand’s Super Plush Bath Towels above, Brooklinen’s best-selling Super Plush Robe is made from the same long-staple Turkish cotton that’s just as absorbent and soft to the touch. Unlike most robes, it has adjustable cuffs—plus pockets—and comes in unisex sizes XS to XL. With lots of colors and patterns to choose from like hotel white and several stripe options—we think it’d make an excellent gift for moms, bosses, and choosy in-laws alike. (The lighter faster-drying Brooklinen waffle robe is also 25% off at checkout.)Blake Bakkila is a freelance writer and editor with eight years of experience covering topics including interior design, real estate, baby and parenting, food, health, and pop culture. In addition to Architectural Digest, her work has appeared in the digital publications of Sunset, Delish, and more. She highlighted the best,... Read moreRead MoreInside ‘SNL’ Star Heidi Gardner’s Midcentury Kansas City HomeToday, AD is welcomed by SNL star Heidi Gardner to tour her midcentury home in Kansas City. When she’s not making us laugh on ‘Saturday Night Live’, Gardner leaves NYC behind, heading back to the Midwest for a slower pace of life. The actor and comedian moved into a midcentury-modern home that soon became a disco-era fantasy with the help of Tara Davis of Cicada Company and Brooklyn-based interior designer Madelynn Hudson. From terrazzo floors to a disco ball stove hood, Gardner’s home is full of fun finishes inspired by memories of her youth and her all-time favorite movie Boogie Nights. “Having a glamorous and gregarious mom and a fashion-forward dad, their whole lives were their prime—but in the ’70s they were especially killing it,” she says. “My dream was to make the house a sexy-chic time capsule.”Inside Famous Homes at ChristmasFrom Kris Jenner to the Vice President of the United States, decorating for the holiday season is a big affair. Today, AD steps inside some famous homes to see how they prepare for Christmas.Francis Ford Coppola Breaks Down The Design of ‘Megalopolis’Today, AD is joined by legendary director Francis Ford Coppola to break down the architectural details of ‘Megalopolis’. Modeling the fall of Rome in an alternate version of New York City, ‘Megalopolis’ has been ‘The Godfather’ director’s passion project for over 40 years. Join Coppola as he discusses the metaphors behind his movie’s design and how he brought his long-awaited dream to life. MEGALOPOLIS is now available On Demand.How ‘Wicked’ Built Immersive Real-Life Sets, From Shiz To Emerald CityToday, AD welcomes production designer Nathan Crowley to explain how he designed the sets for ‘Wicked’. Through his extensive use of practical effects, Crowley designed sets where Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo could shine and come alive as Glinda and Elphaba. From planting nine million tulips for Munchkinland to Shiz’s 52-foot high set, Crowley’s designs for ‘Wicked’ are truly immersive and nothing short of impressive. WICKED is in theaters November 22, https://www.wickedmovie.com/27 Best Christmas Ornaments of 2024Shop merry and bright picks to add to your holiday collectionNew York Skyline: Everything You Need to Know About the Big Apple’s Big BuildingsThe skyline is among the world’s most recognizable, from One World Trade Center to Empire State Building and more47 Gifts for Men Under $50 That They’ll Actually UseFrom cameras to cookware, these budget-friendly picks are sure to impress18 Exterior House Colors That Add Major Curb AppealWhether you go for classic white or a more daring hue, these colors will help your house make a great first impression
html:
See all the early deals we’ve added to our carts during this bedding blowout

All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Even though Black Friday doesn’t officially kick off until next week, there’s plenty to shop right now. Year after year, the top-notch Brooklinen Black Friday sale delivers—and 2024’s markdowns are well worth the hype. Now until December 1, you can save 25% off sitewide when you apply the code “BLACKFRIDAY25” at checkout. We’re talking markdowns everything you know you love (or want to try) from Brooklinen, like crisp percale-cotton sheet sets, breathable linen duvet covers, and super-plush bath towels and robes (all of which make cozy, excellent holiday gifts).

Beyond the sitewide sale, bundles are also 50% off, allowing you to save on additional home goods like towels, comforters, pillows, and more. For a full scope of the sale, we’ve curated the deals we’re most excited about—including some we’ve already added to our virtual shopping carts.

  • 1/6

    Brooklinen Washed Linen Core Sheet Set

    Let’s start with Brooklinen’s bread and butter, their original offering: the linen sheets. Contributor Madeleine Luckel was wooed by the body-heat-regulating claims of the natural fiber: “When I got these, I thought white linen sheets year-round might be a slightly bold move, since I don’t live my life on a Greek island, but the nature of the fiber is versatile and temperature-regulating.”

    And don’t just take our word for it. The best-selling sheets also received a Cleverest Award back in 2021 when illustrator Jordan Sondler said this set “suits the beach-town homemaker I aspire to be and maybe always have been.” Whether you just need a simple fitted sheet or a full set with a duvet cover and pillowcase, Brooklinen has the functionality to customize your order to your liking.

  • 2/6

    Brooklinen Luxe Sateen Core Sheet Set

    If linen doesn’t speak to you, Brooklinen’s all-season Luxe Core Sheet Set is a more classic style that’s cool to the touch. It’s a favorite of commerce director Rachel Fletcher, who says she can “definitely feel the difference in quality and the benefits of a higher thread count.” Overall, it’s ideal for sweaty sleepers who prefer something crisper and more substantial than the linen above. Plus, it comes in shades like your standard white or cream, along with limited-edition options like dusky blue and warm toffee.

  • 3/6

    Brooklinen Luxe Sateen Hardcore Sheet Bundle

    Though sateen may initially conjure up visions of ‘80s decadence, these sheets from Brooklinen are as luxurious as they are modern and subtle. With a 480-thread count, they’re a great year-round option.

  • 4/6

    Brooklinen Down Alternative Comforter

    Hailed as the best organic comforter by our editors, Brooklinen’s down alternative comforter is backed by hundreds of five-star reviews. This standout pick is loaded up with eco-friendly and hypoallergenic PET fibers, and it’s available in three different weights—lightweight for the warmer months or hot sleepers, ultra-warm to combat the cold, or all-season for year-round use.

  • 5/6

    Brooklinen Super-Plush Bath Towels

    Another do-not-miss from the Brooklinen sale: The luxe Turkish-cotton Super Plush Bath Towels. They’re the “densest towels on the market,” according to the brand, and are crafted with a special “Z-twist” terrycloth weave that retains plushness even after dozens of washes. (“This is not a towel that has to be washed 100 times before you want to cuddle up in it,” assures contributor Amanda Sims.)

  • 6/6

    Brooklinen Super Plush Robe

    Inspired by the brand’s Super Plush Bath Towels above, Brooklinen’s best-selling Super Plush Robe is made from the same long-staple Turkish cotton that’s just as absorbent and soft to the touch. Unlike most robes, it has adjustable cuffs—plus pockets—and comes in unisex sizes XS to XL. With lots of colors and patterns to choose from like hotel white and several stripe options—we think it’d make an excellent gift for moms, bosses, and choosy in-laws alike. (The lighter faster-drying Brooklinen waffle robe is also 25% off at checkout.)

Blake Bakkila is a freelance writer and editor with eight years of experience covering topics including interior design, real estate, baby and parenting, food, health, and pop culture. In addition to Architectural Digest, her work has appeared in the digital publications of Sunset, Delish, and more. She highlighted the best,... Read more

Read More

Inside ‘SNL’ Star Heidi Gardner’s Midcentury Kansas City Home

Today, AD is welcomed by SNL star Heidi Gardner to tour her midcentury home in Kansas City. When she’s not making us laugh on ‘Saturday Night Live’, Gardner leaves NYC behind, heading back to the Midwest for a slower pace of life. The actor and comedian moved into a midcentury-modern home that soon became a disco-era fantasy with the help of Tara Davis of Cicada Company and Brooklyn-based interior designer Madelynn Hudson. From terrazzo floors to a disco ball stove hood, Gardner’s home is full of fun finishes inspired by memories of her youth and her all-time favorite movie Boogie Nights. “Having a glamorous and gregarious mom and a fashion-forward dad, their whole lives were their prime—but in the ’70s they were especially killing it,” she says. “My dream was to make the house a sexy-chic time capsule.”

Inside Famous Homes at Christmas

From Kris Jenner to the Vice President of the United States, decorating for the holiday season is a big affair. Today, AD steps inside some famous homes to see how they prepare for Christmas.

Francis Ford Coppola Breaks Down The Design of ‘Megalopolis’

Today, AD is joined by legendary director Francis Ford Coppola to break down the architectural details of ‘Megalopolis’. Modeling the fall of Rome in an alternate version of New York City, ‘Megalopolis’ has been ‘The Godfather’ director’s passion project for over 40 years. Join Coppola as he discusses the metaphors behind his movie’s design and how he brought his long-awaited dream to life. MEGALOPOLIS is now available On Demand.

How ‘Wicked’ Built Immersive Real-Life Sets, From Shiz To Emerald City

Today, AD welcomes production designer Nathan Crowley to explain how he designed the sets for ‘Wicked’. Through his extensive use of practical effects, Crowley designed sets where Ariana Grande and Cynthia Erivo could shine and come alive as Glinda and Elphaba. From planting nine million tulips for Munchkinland to Shiz’s 52-foot high set, Crowley’s designs for ‘Wicked’ are truly immersive and nothing short of impressive. WICKED is in theaters November 22, https://www.wickedmovie.com/
